speakerBioSummary.text:
• Kristen Bell is an actress, philanthropist, and producer who is well known as the voice of "Anna" in Frozen and Frozen 2, two of the highest-grossing animated films of all time.
  • She also starred in Warner Brothers' Veronica Mars and the NBC series, The Good Place.
  • She can currently be seen starring in the animated Amazon children’s series Do, Re, & Mi and STX Film’s couponing adventure, Queenpins.
  • Additional credits include Bad Moms, Bad Moms Christmas, Olaf’s Frozen Adventure, How To Be A Latin Lover, The Lifeguard, The Boss, Hit & Run, Couples Retreat, and Forgetting Sarah Marshall.
  • Bell and her husband, Dax Shepard, co-founded Hello Bello, an affordable line of premium plant-based children's products crafted with babies, parents, and the planet in mind.
  • She is also a co-founder of This Saves Lives, a snack company fighting malnutrition by sending a packet of life-saving food to a child in need for every purchase.

speakerBiography.text:
Kristen Bell is an actress, philanthropist, and producer who can be seen starring in the animated Amazon children’s series Do, Re, & Mi and STX Film’s couponing adventure Queenpins. She also hosts a family game show, Family Game Fight, with her husband Dax Shepard, is in Netflix’s parody comedy, The Woman in the House, and stars in the upcoming film, The People We Hate at the Wedding, alongside Allison Janney and Ben Platt.

She previously starred in the NBC series The Good Place, opposite Ted Danson, and reprised her role as "Anna" in Frozen 2, which with 1.3 billion thus far, surpassed the $1.2 billion Frozen earned worldwide and took over the top position as the highest grossing animated film of all time. Additionally, Bell executive produced and appeared in a second season of Encore, which can be found on Disney’s streaming platform Disney+.

Bell was seen as "Jeannie Van Der Hooven" in the Showtime series House of Lies opposite Don Cheadle, which wrapped its fifth and final season. Bell reprised her beloved title role in Warner Brothers’ film Veronica Mars, which raised $2 million on Kickstarter in less than eleven hours and broke the record at the time for the fastest project to reach $1 million and $2 million. She also brought back the role for a revival of the series on Hulu. She appeared in a guest-starring arc on NBC’s hit series Parks & Recreation and played the lead role in the independent film The Lifeguard, which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.

Her other film credits include Bad Moms, Bad Moms Christmas, PANDAS, Olaf’s Frozen Adventure, Teen Titans Go! to the Movies, Like Father, CHIPs, How To Be A Latin Lover, The Lifeguard, The Boss, Hit & Run, Movie 43, Some Girls, Writers,  Big Miracle, You Again, Burlesque, When in Rome, Couples Retreat, Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Pulse,  Serious Moonlight, and David Mamet’s Spartan.

Her television credits include Veronica Mars, Parks & Recreation, Unsupervised, Deadwood, Heroes, and Party Down.

Her Broadway credits include The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and The Crucible, opposite Liam Neeson and Laura Linney. Her Off-Broadway credits include Reefer Madness and A Little Night Music.
